availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Clinton B. Fisk (St. Louis, Missouri, Brevet Major General (U.S.A.))

body.p: St. Louis, Missouri, Brevet Major General (U.S.A.). New York native. Father of Charles Fish and May Fish. Served in 33rd Missouri Volunteer Regiment (U.S.A.) as Colonel from September 5, 1862 to November 24, 1862. Commissioned Brigadier General on November 24, 1862. Brevetted Major General March 1865. Appointed commissioner of the Bureau of Refugees, Freedmen, and Abandoned Lands (Freedmenâ€™s Bureau) c1865.

ab.bibl: Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Missouri, St. Louis, St. Louis, p. 337.Find A Grave, "Clinton B. Fisk (December 8, 1828-July 9, 1890)," Memorial #5892361, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5892361 (accessed January 29, 2020). Ezra J.Warner Generals in Blue: Lives of Union Commanders (Baton Rouge, LA: Louisiana State University Press, 1964), 154-155.
